events.originalText: An explosion on Deepwater Horizon, an offshore rig in the Gulf of Mexico, resulted in the largest marine oil spill in history.
events.subtitle: Deepwater Horizon explosion
events.headline: Explosion on Deepwater Horizon rig leads to largest marine oil spill in history

events.originalText: American racing driver Danica Patrick won the Indy Japan 300, becoming the first woman to win an IndyCar auto race.
events.subtitle: Danica Patrick
events.headline: Danica Patrick makes history as first woman to win IndyCar auto race

events.originalText: Fernando Lugo became the first non–Colorado Party candidate to be elected President of Paraguay in 61 years.
events.subtitle: Fernando Lugo
events.headline: Fernando Lugo elected as first non-Colorado Party President of Paraguay in 61 years

events.originalText: An incomplete tunnel leading to Singapore's Nicoll Highway MRT station collapsed that led to four deaths and the station's relocation.
events.subtitle: Nicoll Highway MRT station
events.headline: Tunnel collapse at Nicoll Highway MRT station in Singapore results in four deaths

events.originalText: Students Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold embarked on a massacre, killing 13 people and wounding more than 20 others before committing suicide at Columbine High School in Columbine, Colorado.
events.subtitle: Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold
events.headline: Massacre at Columbine High School leaves 13 dead and over 20 wounded

events.originalText: Korean Air Lines Flight 902 was shot down after violating Soviet airspace, forcing it to make an emergency landing.
events.subtitle: Korean Air Lines Flight 902
events.headline: Korean Air Lines Flight 902 shot down after violating Soviet airspace

events.originalText: Pierre Trudeau was sworn in as prime minister of Canada, succeeding Lester B. Pearson.
events.subtitle: Pierre Trudeau
events.headline: Pierre Trudeau sworn in as prime minister of Canada

events.originalText: Enoch Powell (pictured), a British Conservative member of Parliament, made a controversial speech in opposition to immigration and anti-discrimination legislation, resulting in his removal from the shadow cabinet.
events.subtitle: Enoch Powell
events.headline: Enoch Powell removed from shadow cabinet after controversial speech on immigration

events.originalText: South African Airways Flight 228 crashed shortly after take-off from Windhoek in South West Africa, resulting in 123 deaths.
events.subtitle: South African Airways Flight 228
events.headline: South African Airways Flight 228 crashes after take-off, 123 dead

events.originalText: World War II: German and Italian forces began a large-scale counter-insurgency operation in occupied Yugoslavia.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German and Italian forces launch counter-insurgency operation in occupied Yugoslavia

events.originalText: Adolf Hitler's 50th birthday was celebrated as a national holiday in Nazi Germany.
events.subtitle: Adolf Hitler
events.headline: Adolf Hitler's 50th birthday celebrated as national holiday in Nazi Germany

events.originalText: Billie Holiday recorded the song "Strange Fruit", which later became an emblem of the civil rights movement.
events.subtitle: Billie Holiday
events.headline: Billie Holiday records iconic civil rights song "Strange Fruit"

events.originalText: A fire and a gun battle between the Colorado National Guard and striking coal miners led to 17 deaths in the Ludlow Massacre.
events.subtitle: Colorado National Guard
events.headline: Ludlow Massacre: 17 dead in fire and gun battle between National Guard and miners

events.originalText: French explorer René Caillié reached Timbuktu in present-day Mali, and later received a 9,000-franc prize from the Société de Géographie for being the first European to return with a description of the city.
events.subtitle: René Caillié
events.headline: French explorer René Caillié reaches Timbuktu, wins prize for first European description

events.originalText: Four days after the Court of King's Bench upheld an English murder suspect's right to a trial by battle in Ashford v Thornton, the plaintiff declined to fight, allowing the defendant to go free.
events.subtitle: Court of King's Bench (England)
events.headline: English murder suspect's trial by battle ends with plaintiff declining to fight

events.originalText: War of the Fifth Coalition: Commanded by Napoleon, Franco-German forces defeated a reinforced Austrian corps at the Battle of Abensberg.
events.subtitle: War of the Fifth Coalition
events.headline: Napoleon's forces defeat Austrians at Battle of Abensberg in Fifth Coalition War

events.originalText: Anglo-Spanish War: The English navy sank much of a Spanish treasure fleet at the Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife off the Canary Islands, but was unable to capture the treasure.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Spanish War (1654–1660)
events.headline: English navy sinks Spanish treasure fleet at Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife

events.originalText: Bacatá, the main settlement of the Muisca Confederation in present-day Colombia, was conquered by Spanish conquistadors led by Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada.
events.subtitle: Bacatá
events.headline: Spanish conquistadors conquer Bacatá in Colombia

events.originalText: Sun dogs were observed over Stockholm, Sweden, inspiring the painting Vädersolstavlan (depicted), the oldest coloured depiction of the city.
events.subtitle: Sun dog
events.headline: Sun dogs over Stockholm inspire oldest coloured depiction of the city
